versions.description: Maintenance release with new AMQP support and smaller modules

fields.summary: Network bridge causes deadlock on queue/topic when message dispatch and consumer registration overlap.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Deadlock in DemandForwardingBridgeSupport class if ConsumerInfo message has arrived before BrokerInfo message.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We are experiencing a situation where a broker deadlocks when starting a duplex bridge and the startup interferes with message delivery (I suppose). The broker is running embedded in Glassfish 3.1.2.2.

{code}

The solution working for us was to revert commit [AMQ3274Test, org.apache.activemq.usecases.NetworkBridgeProducerFlowControlTest - sync needs to be conditional|https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/806ec21eb6c5969c11f235111b00d5b808f00aef].
fields.summary: Fix of AMQ-4328 causes deadlocks during set up of the bridge

comments.body: These issues seem to report similar condition for older releases.
Recommend you test against a 5.9-SNAPSHOT before digging to deep.
No unit test or other means of testing, many fixes in this area since this was logged.
